messages.subject: Re: Faking a Meiji Era Photo
messages.msgSnippet: Well, I put this site up on the Miburo Database under Japanese Sites months ago:) and I brought up the mystery female Shinsengumi issue based on this
messages.messageBody:
Well, I put this site up on the Miburo Database under "Japanese Sites"
months ago:) and I brought up the mystery female Shinsengumi issue
based on this site...babelfish is our friend...I wanted to "steal" the
image of the fish and have Saitou gatotsu it but whenever I tried to
grab the image it ended up being too small.

The site also has Buddhist posthumous names and poetry...everything in
chart format.

--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, Barbara Sheridan <bsher213@b...> wrote:
> How could leave out the Wife/Mistress chart! You should know by now
> that there are certain twisted inquiring minds around here that want to
> know this stuff--even if it only vaguely understandable through
> *expletive deleted* babelfish
>
> Tiffany wrote:
>
> >This site http://g1342122.at.infoseek.co.jp is by the way -the- best
> >shinsengumi info site in Japanese...and the only site which tackles
> >the mystery woman in the Shinsengumi (Nobori Nakajima painted a pic of
> >her if you recall)
> >
> >
>
> --
> Barbara Sheridan
> http://www.barbarasheridan.net

messages.subject: Faking a Meiji Era Photo
messages.msgSnippet: This site http://g1342122.at.infoseek.co.jp is by the way -the- best shinsengumi info site in Japanese...and the only site which tackles the mystery woman in
messages.messageBody:
This site http://g1342122.at.infoseek.co.jp is by the way -the- best
shinsengumi info site in Japanese...and the only site which tackles
the mystery woman in the Shinsengumi (Nobori Nakajima painted a pic of
her if you recall)

Now, the webmaster decided to post of pic of himself:
http://g1342122.at.infoseek.co.jp/aisatu.htm

LOL

secretarytocapt3
http://www.shinsengumimb.com
